mainmatter.p: An unsorted signature \Sigma is an \mathbb{N}-indexed family \{ \mathsf{op} _n \} _{n \in \mathbb{N} }, where elements \mathsf{op} _n are called the n-ary operation symbols of \Sigma. The 0-ary symbols c \in F_0 are called the constant symbols.

frontmatter.title: Set Theory and Algebra in Computer Science

mainmatter.p:
Let \Sigma = \{ F_n \} _{n \in \mathbb{N} } be an unsorted signature. A \Sigma-algebra is a pair (A, \llbracket {-} \rrbracket ) where
A is a set.
\left \{ \llbracket {-} \rrbracket _n \right \} _{n \in \mathbb{N} } is a family of functions such that \llbracket {-} \rrbracket _n : F_n \to A^n \to A.
